answer:
Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis:

• Frame 1: The camera faces a wide multi‐lane roadway. Vehicles are in both directions. A crosswalk spans the lanes, and at the right edge in the distance, there appears to be a sign but it is not fully legible at this angle.  
• Frame 2: Slightly farther along, with fewer vehicles blocking a clearer view. There is still a “30” on a sign visible in the distance (on the right).  
• Frame 3: The speed‐limit sign to the right is now more apparent and shows “Speed Limit 30.”  
• Frame 4: The sign stands out more clearly, reading “30” and “Radar Enforced.”  
• Frame 5: The sign is fully legible: “Speed Limit 30 – Radar Enforced.”

Contextual Reasoning:
Across frames 1 to 5, the most notable repeated sign is the “Speed Limit 30” sign (especially clear in frames 3 to 5). There is no other speed‐related signage indicating a different limit. This strongly suggests that the speed limit at this location is 30 mph.

Match to Answer Choices:
• A (35 mph) – No evidence of 35 mph signage.  
• B (30 mph) – Consistently matches the visible “Speed Limit 30” signs.  
• C (25 mph) – No signage indicates 25 mph.  
• D (45 mph) – No signage or context suggests such a high limit.

Provide the Best Answer:
<answer>B</answer>
